name: Life Logger AI: Daily Journal Generator

options.subtitle: This is for demo purposes. Try me out !
options.title: Your first AI Agent üöÄ

parameters.content:
## üöÄ Life Logger AI Setup Guide

This n8n workflow is a sophisticated RAG system. It automatically transforms your digital footprint‚Äîphotos, calendar events, weather, and news‚Äîinto a cohesive, first-person diary entry stored in Google Docs.

**Credentials:** Ensure Google Drive, Google Docs, Google Calendar, Postgres, and Google Gemini (PaLM) APIs are connected.

**Database:** This workflow requires a Postgres database with the pgvector extension enabled to store photo descriptions.

**How it works:** > - The Top Row runs daily to analyze your new photos.

The Agent combines those photo descriptions with your Calendar and Weather.

The Final Output is appended to your specified Google Doc.

## Zone 1: The Image Processing Pipeline
This section runs on a schedule to "digest" your photos so the AI can "remember" them later.

parameters.text:
=ramdonly choose one image then analyze the image , Include locations, activities, emotions, and weather,

Analyze the image in depth , then you imagine you are the user. write a single, continuous paragraph, Write in first person, conversational tone, 200-300 words, include locations, activities, emotions, and weather. 

Output Format: Write everything as one fluid, cohesive paragraph with no bullet points or line breaks.


You output must include Title, Date, Content three parts.

** Title: ** this daily title
** Date: **today date
** Content: ** rite a single, continuous paragraph, Write in first person, conversational tone, 200-300 words, include locations, activities, emotions, and weather. 

EXAMPLE OUTPUT:

"
Title: laughed together at a restaurant table
Date: {{$now }}
Content: Today's morning is so cold, i laughed together at a restaurant table with pizza and wine with my friend, i really enjoy this moment. "

options.systemMessage:
=You are a writing Assistant for write my personal diary. You can answer user questions and fulfill their requests. You are conversational.

Refer to the image desciption I gave to you in Postgres PGVector Store  . You can randomly choose 1 image inside the image. Then you need to analyze the image, Include locations, activities, emotions, and weather, and finally help me write today's visual diary. Include locations, activities, emotions, and weather. Write in first person, conversational tone, 200-300 words.

dont descible too much of the weather or location, it is a daily , you should write more about what happenend and the emotion.

dont output any word like "hello Daily". 

Today date is {{ $now.toFormat('LLLL dd, yyyy') }}. 

Output Format: Write everything as one fluid, cohesive paragraph with no bullet points or line breaks.


You output must include Title, Date, Content three parts.

**Title:** this daily title.
**Date:**{{ $now.toFormat('LLLL dd, yyyy') }}.
**Content:** rite a single, continuous paragraph, Write in first person, conversational tone, 200-300 words, include locations, activities, emotions, and weather. Write in first person, conversational tone, 200-300 words.


You have five primary tool:

1. Today's weather you can find on this open-meteo.com api (link: https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast).

2. Google Calendar for you  check Today's activities.

3. Google Drive for you to download the image (if you need)

4. getting news in https://feeds.bbci.co.uk/news/world/rss.xml  (if you need)

5. Postgres PGVector Store  for you to find image content.

when you ready to output , upload your output to my google doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1VS9Jth0OqbLsSIL-6kz3brkw7EOi2LKTgRpjIemn2QM/edit?tab=t.0

parameters.toolDescription: Use this knowledge base to answer questions from the user

Get weather forecast anywhere, anytime. You can make requests by assuming most information, the only thing you need is the location (use the city name to infer lat and long automatically) and time period (assume today if not specified)

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.value: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters0_Value', `Latitude of the location, e.g. 45.75 for Lyon. Do not ask the user just infer it automatically.`, 'string') }}

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.value: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters1_Value', `Longitude of the location, e.g. 4.85 for Lyon. Do not ask the user just infer it automatically.`, 'string') }}

hourly
daily

- https://feeds.bbci.co.uk/news/world/rss.xml (BBC World ‚Äì global headlines)
- https://www.aljazeera.com/xml/rss/all.xml (Al‚ÄØJazeera English ‚Äì in‚Äëdepth global coverage)
- http://rss.cnn.com/rss/edition_world.rss (CNN World ‚Äì breaking news worldwide)
- https://techcrunch.com/feed/ (TechCrunch ‚Äì global tech & startup news)
- http://news.ycombinator.com/rss (Hacker News ‚Äì tech community headlines)
- https://n8n.io/blog/rss (n8n Blog ‚Äì updates & tutorials)
- https://www.bonappetit.com/feed/recipes-rss-feed/rss (Bon App√©tit ‚Äì recent recipes list)
- https://www.endsreport.com/rss/news-and-analysis (ENDS Report ‚Äì environmental law & policy news)
- https://medlineplus.gov/groupfeeds/new.xml (MedlinePlus ‚Äì health topics & wellness updates)`, 'string') }}

parameters.content:
## Zone 2: The AI Agent Core
This is the "brain" of the operation that decides how to write your journal.
